To participate in the validation session: To participate in the validation session, you must provide your flips

The number of flips that can be reported
should be limited to 1/3
A good flip earns you rewards in iDNA: A good flip earns you rewards in iDNA
A bad flip penalizes you in iDNA: A bad flip penalizes you in iDNA
A good flip tells a story, assembled chr: A good flip tells a story, assembled chronologically, to represent an event or a process from beginning to end.
A good flip is EASY to solve for humans,: A good flip is EASY to solve for humans, but hard for robots.
A good flip uses clear, simple images, a: A good flip uses clear, simple images, and lets the story be obvious, with no ambiguity.
A good flip uses no text.
A good flip uses simple concepts that AN: A good flip uses simple concepts that ANYONE IN THE WORLD will easily understand, regardless of their native language or culture.
A good flip should be relevant to both o: A good flip should be relevant to both of the seed words.
A good flip makes use of the tools avail: A good flip makes use of the tools available including DRAWING and COLLAGE to help battle against AI and add creativity.
A good flip uses the shuffle to create a: A good flip uses the shuffle to create a 100% non logical alternative.
A bad flip has NO logical story, even if: A bad flip has NO logical story, even if it uses both keywords.
A bad flip contains numbers or letters o: A bad flip contains numbers or letters on images.
A bad flip is hard to understand.
A bad flip contains hateful, inappropria: A bad flip contains hateful, inappropriate or NSFW content.
A bad flip does NOT USE BOTH keywords in: A bad flip does NOT USE BOTH keywords in the story.
A bad flip uses objects in images in seq: A bad flip uses objects in images in sequence (1-2-3-4).
If even one of your submitted flips are: If even one of your submitted flips are reported during validation, you loose 100% of your rewards including invitation rewards for that validation
